article.title: Notation conventions
article.description: Notation conventions for representing static and variable path segments of resource URIs for the Sync Gateway REST APIs

introduction.paragraph: The Sync Gateway API References use specific notation conventions for representing static and variable path segments of REST resource URIs.
Within the paths of the URIs presented in these guides:

unordered-list.list-item: Path segments that start with an underscore character are static path segments of the URI that you use exactly as shown, for example: _replicate.

Path segments that do not start with an underscore character are variables that you replace with your own values. To emphasize that these path segments are variables, we enclose them in curly braces as a reminder, for example: {db}. Some places in the documentation, you also will see angle brackets used as the indication of a variable path segment, for example, <db>.

introduction.paragraph: For example, suppose you have a database named cookbook. In the database, the IDs for documents that contain recipes start with the string recipe.
